Given a category `C` endowed with a shift by an additive monoid `M` and two objects `X` and `Y` in `C`, we consider the types `ShiftedHom X Y m` defined as `X âŸ¶ (YâŸ¦mâŸ§)` for all `m : M`, and the composition on these shifted hom.

Should this be a simp lemma?

I would rather not make these simp lemmas. If I had defined `ShiftedHom` as a single field `hom` structure, it would have very much made sense to have such a simp(s) lemma `mkâ‚€_comp_hom`, but otherwise, I prefer not to. (I will use a single field structure when I repackage this for Ext-groups #13599.)
